p: Since the winter of 2014, Jiangsu [ 36] and Zhejiang Province [ 35] in China have reported AGE outbreaks caused by a novel NoV genotype, GII.17. NoV GII.17 has a polymerase sequence and amino acid substitution in the capsid region, according to a study by Matesushiam et al. [ 37]. The novel GII.17 genotype was first detected in AGE patients in Aug 2014 in Pudong New Area [ 17], before the first report of an outbreak in Jiangsu. AGE outbreaks caused by the novel GII.17 genotype have also been reported from nurseries, schools and a military unit [ 38, 39]. NoV GII.17 could be detected in AGE patients, their close contacts and environmental surfaces such as trash cans and toilet bowls [ 5].
